name: Apple Scab
symptoms: Dark, scaly lesions on leaves and fruit.
organic_control: Use sulfur-based sprays and remove infected leaves.
chemical_control: Apply fungicides like Captan or Mancozeb.
causes: Caused by the fungus Venturia inaequalis.
prevention: Ensure good air circulation and plant disease-resistant varieties.

name: Tomato Blight
symptoms: Dark spots on leaves and fruit, leading to rot.
organic_control: Use copper sprays and practice crop rotation.
prevention: Avoid overhead watering and space plants properly.

name: Black Spot (Rose)
symptoms: Black spots on rose leaves, leading to yellowing and defoliation.
organic_control: Use neem oil and prune affected leaves.
chemical_control: Apply fungicides like chlorothalonil or myclobutanil.
causes: Caused by the fungus Diplocarpon rosae.
prevention: Ensure good air circulation and avoid overhead watering.

name: Apple Black Rot
symptoms: Dark, sunken lesions on fruit and cankers on branches.
organic_control: Prune infected branches and apply neem oil.
causes: Caused by the fungus Botryosphaeria obtusa.
prevention: Avoid overhead watering and remove fallen debris.

name: Cedar Apple Rust
symptoms: Orange, gelatinous spore masses on fruit and leaves.
organic_control: Remove nearby cedar trees and apply sulfur sprays.

name: Cherry Powdery Mildew
symptoms: White powdery growth on leaves and fruit.
organic_control: Apply neem oil or baking soda solution.
prevention: Ensure good air circulation and avoid over-fertilization.

name: corn cercospora Leaf Spot
symptoms: Small, dark spots with reddish-purple borders on leaves.
organic_control: Rotate crops and use resistant varieties.
causes: Caused by the fungus Cercospora zeae-maydis.
prevention: Avoid excessive nitrogen fertilizer and remove infected debris.

name: Maize Common Rust
organic_control: Encourage good air circulation and use resistant hybrids.
causes: Caused by the fungus Puccinia sorghi.
prevention: Plant rust-resistant corn varieties and rotate crops.

name: Corn Northern Leaf Blight
symptoms: Gray-green or brown elliptical lesions on leaves.
organic_control: Practice crop rotation and increase plant spacing.
chemical_control: Use fungicides like mancozeb or chlorothalonil.
causes: Caused by the fungus Exserohilum turcicum.
prevention: Use resistant hybrids and avoid dense planting.

name: Grape Black Rot
symptoms: Dark, sunken lesions on fruit that dry and shrivel.
organic_control: Prune infected vines and use neem oil.
causes: Caused by the fungus Guignardia bidwellii.
prevention: Remove infected leaves and avoid overhead irrigation.

name: Grape Black Measles
symptoms: Dark streaks on vines and brown spotting on fruit.
organic_control: Remove infected wood and improve soil drainage.
causes: Caused by multiple fungal species including Phaeomoniella chlamydospora.
prevention: Avoid excessive irrigation and prune affected branches.

name: Grape Leaf Blight
symptoms: Brown, V-shaped lesions on leaves with yellow margins.
organic_control: Apply compost tea and prune infected leaves.
prevention: Ensure proper air circulation and use resistant varieties.

name: Orange Citrus Greening
symptoms: Yellow mottling on leaves and misshapen, bitter fruit.
organic_control: Introduce beneficial insects to control psyllids.
chemical_control: Apply insecticides to control vector insects.
causes: Caused by the bacterium Candidatus Liberibacter spp.
prevention: Remove infected trees and use disease-free seedlings.

name: Peach Bacterial Spot
symptoms: Small, dark spots on leaves and fruit, leading to defoliation.
organic_control: Prune affected branches and apply neem oil.
causes: Caused by the bacterium Xanthomonas arboricola.
prevention: Ensure good drainage and remove infected plant material.

name: Pepper Bell Bacterial Spot
symptoms: Water-soaked lesions on leaves and fruit.
organic_control: Use copper sprays and rotate crops.
prevention: Avoid overhead watering and use disease-free seeds.

name: Strawberry Leaf Scorch
symptoms: Reddish-brown spots on leaves that merge, leading to leaf death.
organic_control: Improve air circulation and remove infected leaves.
causes: Caused by the fungus Diplocarpon earlianum.
prevention: Avoid overhead watering and use resistant strawberry varieties.
